org.sopra.api

Interface Scenario


  • public interface Scenario
    A scenario is the data type the game is played on. Each scenario contains a playfield, a model of the land consisting of grasslands, rivers, mountains, seas and beaches. EnergyNodes are placed on this playfield. An energy node is either a producer (all kinds of power plants) or a consumer (e.g. cities or industrial parks, anything that consumes energy). These nodes are connected by edges (power lines that transport energy from producers to consumers). Edges and nodes form a graph. The scenario also features functionality to gain information on the current status of the graph and the environment and a command factory that allows to create commands that regulate controllable energy nodes.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BuildingConfig getBuildingConfig()
      Returns the framework configuration for building abilities.
      CommandFactory getCommandFactory()
      Returns the command factory for this scenario.

      Returns the cost calculator factory for this scenario.

      Returns the framework configuration for energy nodes.
      Graph<EnergyNode,PowerLine> getGraph()
      Returns the graph of the scenario.
      java.util.List<PlantLocation> getPlantLocations()
      Returns a list of all locations with energy nodes in this scenario.
      Playfield getPlayfield()
      Returns the playfield of this scenario.
      PowerLineConfig getPowerLineConfig()
      Returns the framework configuration for power lines.
      Statistics getStatistics()
      Returns the scenario's statistics.
